SADIKI’S ROOM - CONTINUOUS ACTION 132 Sadiki’s laptop sits on the desk, asleep. Ferris taps the space bar and the computer’s wallpaper of the wandering man’s devoted traditional family blinks on. INT. SADIKI’S CAR - MOVING - SAME TIME - NIGHT 133 Something occurs to Sadiki. Irritated with himself, he turns the car around and heads back to the hotel -- INT. SADIKI’S ROOM - SAME TIME - NIGHT 134 Ferris opens a secure email account, highlights all the files on Sadiki’s desktop and sends them as attachments -

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The attachments begin downloading onto Garland’s laptop, the icons appearing one by one on his desktop -- EXT. SADIKI’S ISLAMIC HOTEL - SAME TIME - NIGHT 136 Sadiki pulls his car up to the entrance of his hotel, tells the valet to keep it running, he’1ll be right back. INT. SADIKI’S ROOM - SAME TIME - NIGHT 137 Ferris has moved on to hard-drive files, sending them all to Garland while he talks to him on the phone --

dialogues.speaker: GARLAND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: This is useful. An email list for the Brothers of Awareness. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: The brothers of who the fuck?

dialogues.speaker: GARLAND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Ikhwan Ishfan.

dialogues.speaker: GARLAND
dialogues.text: It's just a study group of believers at his mosque but I can make it look like anything.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Make it look like everything. INT. SADIKI’S ISLAMIC HOTEL - SAME TIME - NIGHT 139 Sadiki comes through the lobby, gets into an elevator.

dialogues.speaker: GARLAND, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Make fake accounts for half a dozen of the brothers and start transferring money to them from Sadiki’s fake receiver account. Small operational sums. INT. SADIKI’S ROOM - SAME TIME - NIGHT 140

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: The Saudis will pick up the money moving, and everything they pick up...

dialogues.speaker: GARLAND, (V.0O.)
dialogues.text: They leak to jihadists.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: You got it, my friend. INT. SADIKI’S ISLAMIC HOTEL - SAME TIME - NIGHT 141 Sadiki emerges from the elevator. Comes down the Opens his door with a card key -- As he steps in, we (but not Sadiki) see Ferris is on the balcony, back to the wall, French doors closed -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sadiki rummages around his toiletries, finds a 3-PACK OF CONDOMS, heads back for the door, hesitating when he sees his computer’s desktop of his family -- It unsettles him, but it’s unclear if that’s because they’re “looking” at him, or because the computer should have gone to sleep in his absence. In any case, he’s got more exciting things to think about, and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris is walking.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Pull up an Arabic keyboard and take down this message.

dialogues.speaker: GARLAND
dialogues.text: doing so.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) ‘In the name of God, we praise our Brothers who shall carry out this heroic act in the Fig Orchard, and beg God to give us strength in our continuing struggle. The time is at hand.’

dialogues.speaker: GARLAND
dialogues.text: (amused) That's good Arabic. What’s the Fig Orchard?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Well, I really haven’t let you in on that one just yet. Let’s say it’s developing.

dialogues.speaker: GARLAND
dialogues.text: It will create chatter, but it’1l have to be big to get Al-Saleem’s attention.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: It'll be big. Put the message in Arabic and send it from Sadiki’s fake e-mail account. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Ferris snaps his phone shut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris emerges from a terminal talking on his “Scanlon” cell --

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Mr. Sadiki. It’s Brad. I'm fine, but we have a bit of a problem. Our chief engineer, who’s based up in Ankara, has raised some questions about the insulation... Yeah, I know it’s the same as what you use in Saudi Arabia... But you’re going to have to go up to Ankara, ASAP... Ferris sees SKIP pulling up in an Embassy car and crosses to it. Into the phone:

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: No, he can’t come to you, and in fact, the only day you can see him is this Wednesday. We’1ll fly you, of course... no, I’m sorry, Business Class... let me give you his address and numbers. You got a pen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garland steps carefully around his garden, tending strawberry plants.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Garland will send out a message from Sadiki hinting that a strike is preparing...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An ANALYST looks from his screen and asks the man beside him:

dialogues.speaker: NSA ANALYST
dialogues.text: What’s the Fig Orchard, and who are the Brothers of Awareness?  145 146 147 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 97.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadiki, about as irritated as a man can be, is met by “Hayes Andover Bank's Construction Head,” a dodgy-looking Muslim. As they move away together -- A BARRAGE OF SURVEILLANCE PHOTOGRAPHS OF THEM -——

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- pop-up on screens here, where Hoffman sits with some analysts, picking at a plate of sprout-ridden health food that he hates while the others eat wonderful-looking junk food. Other screens in front of them show live views of a military base.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: When the strike is done, he’1l post another message taking responsibility for the bombing -- One of the screens shows a live image of a Blackhawk landing at --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The helicopter settles on the ground. TONY climbs out as a Jeep pulls up to meet him. As Tony supervises the transfer of some equipment from the chopper to the Jeep - SPECIAL FORCES SGT. Got everything you need?

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: Oh, yeah. And that’s because several full body bags are now being off-loaded from the Blackhawk onto a cart. The SPECIAL FORCES SGT. stares.

dialogues.speaker: TONY
dialogues.text: (comic) Bodies from the morgue. Iraq has plenty.  148 149 150 151 152 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 98.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: After the event, a buzz of messages will then pass among jihadist networks announcing the Brothers of Awareness as a new player, and Sadiki as its leader. Sadiki’s face on a screen “watches” Hoffman, who can’t take another bite of his food, toss it in a wastebasket. He takes a French fry off somebody else’s plate.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Wife’s worried about diabetes. Runs in my family... my fuckin’ father. Asshole.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO TURKISH JANITORS push large plastic bins on wheels into the US Bachelor Officers’ Quarters. INT. BACHELOR OFFICERS’ QUARTERS - MOMENTS LATER 150 The “Turkish janitors” (one of whom is “Tony”) -- push their bins into the barracks, and wheel them down the waxed corridor, past... the CORPSES from the body bags -- all Middle Eastern men -- are laid on cots in the officers’ quarters in the late afternoon shadows...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The “Turkish Janitors” leave the building.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A WALL OF INTERNATIONAL CLOCKS. It is ticking towards 4aM in Turkey. And THE SAME LIVE IMAGE from overhead on the main screen.

dialogues.speaker: YOUNG ANALYST
dialogues.text: I’ve got it, I’ve got it. ‘Fig Orchard’ means ‘Incirlik’ in Turkish! (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Brilliant. (turning to screen) Fire in the hole... three, two, one...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Officer’s Quarters explode -- in a flash...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: From 20,000 feet, the overhead image of the explosion -- silent -- unspectacular -- on the screen. To himself --

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: ++. boom. INT./EXT. FERRIS’ APARTMENT (AMMAN) - DUSK 155 A speaker outside a mosque below calls people to prayer. Ferris, having a drink, watches BBC World.

dialogues.speaker: BBC REPORTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Officials have confirmed the target of the blast was the US Bachelor Officers’ Quarters at the airbase at Incirlik, Turkey. The bomb attack destroyed the barracks, but American casualties reportedly were limited because many pilots and officers are away on Christmas leave... INT. HANI’S APARTMENT (AMMAN) - SAME TIME - DUSK 156 Video on Hani’s TV of the smoking ruins and a short line of blanket-covered bodies and body parts. His wife sets out plates and silverware for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: BBC REPORTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: The Pentagon has not released the names of the dead pending notification of next of kin, but we are being told there might not be a public announcement of the casualties because some of the men killed may have been stationed at Incirlik on classified missions...  157

dialogues.speaker: 157A
dialogues.text: 158 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 100. INT. AL-SALEEM'’S HOUSE - SAME TIME - DUSK 157 Some children run past another TV here broadcasting the same report --

dialogues.speaker: BBC REPORTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: No one yet has claimed credit, but terror experts are already speculating, because of the target and the ferocity of the attack, this may be the work of a new offshoot of Al-Quaeda... Al-Saleem glances to another man in the living room. The other man doesn’t know any more than Al-Saleem what that “new offshoot” could be, and gestures as much with a slight shrug.

dialogues.speaker: STOCK NEWS FOOTAGE 157A
dialogues.text: OF “THE ARAB STREET” REJOICING, FIRING WEAPONS INTO THE AIR, ETC, THE WHOLE “FUCK YOU, AMERICA” SPECTACLE THAT HAPPENED AFTER 9/11. GLOBAL REJOICING. INT. FERRIS’ APARTMENT (AMMAN) - CONTINUOUS ACTION - 158

dialogues.speaker: BBC REPORTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Incirlik, which in Turkish means ‘Fig Orchard,’

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Smiling and eating a peach as he watches.

dialogues.speaker: BBC REPORTER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: -.-. has served since September 11 as a primary hub in the wars in Afghanistan and Iraq... One of Ferris’ cell phones vibrates on the desk. He picks it up. The BBC report continues in the b.g.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Yes? (a beat) Hani.  CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 101. 159 INT. HANI’S OFFICE - NEXT MORNING 159 Ferris sits with Hani, who is wearing a tiny candy cane on his lapel.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Is that in deference to your Christian employees?

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: Yes, all none of them. Still, Christmas is for everyone. Here in Jordan, everyone has Christmas trees. Hani pours Ferris a small glass of something.

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: Eggnog!

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Islamic eggnog?

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: You be the judge. FERRIS sips: It is stiff with liquor.

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: First of all, my greatest sympathies to the families of the Incirlik victims.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: Second, I think I can help. Hani pulls a picture from a file and lays it before Ferris: A passport photo of OMAR SADIKI. And a Turkish Customs printout with the date.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: This is the architect you showed me before. Who met the money-man.

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: The same. Only now I think he may have had something to do with this bombing. He was in Turkey on Wednesday, meeting with this man -- an engineer who we know is also an explosives expert. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He sets down a SURVEILLANCE photo of the Muslim man who met Sadiki at Esenboga Airport.

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: Naturally, you can do whatever you want with this information, but if I were you I’d leave Sadiki in place and see what he brings.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Your usual technique. Hani nods. Ferris asks with a look, “May I take this?”

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: Yes. It’s my Christmas gift to you. Use it wisely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Aisha sit atop a jagged cliff overlooking the Dead Sea, 50-kilometers from the nearest tourist floating around on his back reading a newspaper. Here, it’s rugged, still, primeval.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: How often do you come out here?

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: As often as I can. It’s as beautiful as a place can be where nothing lives.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Bacteria lives there.

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: That's romantic. The word hangs there a moment. She smiles and stares back out at the ancient waters. In the distance, some Bedouins on camels ride silently along a ridge.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Aisha? She looks at him a little more expectantly than she intended.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: If you're waiting for me, you're going to have to wait forever. I'd never touch a Muslim woman... first. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: They regard one another... then she touches his hand, and even then he doesn’t do more than allow it. Her hand comes up, touches his neck, the fingers running along one of the scars on it, then to another just under the collar of his T-shirt. Her hand stops there, feeling something sharp, like the tip of a spine of a cactus, trying to work itself out.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: What’d you find? She looks, the nurse in her taking over. Sees a small infected area around the “cactus spine.” She moves it around a little, then gently pulls it out.

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: What is this? It's small, sharp, and white.

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: Is this... Ferris shakes his head he doesn’t know, but of course he does. It’s another piece of Bassam.

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: It looks like bone.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I have no idea what it is, but it’s not bone. How would it get there?

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: I don’t know. She rolls it gently between her fingertips, then holds it out for him to take. He holds out his hand and she drops it onto it. Ferris doesn’t know what to do with it. It seems wrong to throw it away, but he does. INT. FERRIS’ CAR —- MOVING - DAY (LATER) 161 They're driving on a highway, headed back to Amman presumably. Not talking. Until --

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: What if I told you I don’t want anything to do with a man with a secret life.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: What if I told you the same thing. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: I’m not hiding anything. I wish I was. At least we’d be even.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: At the camps you took money from a man that I know is -- how can I say this -- not a simple cleric.

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: What are you talking about? Ferris doesn’t say.

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: Are you talking about Hajazi? He’s a teacher. He donates money for medicine for people who can’t afford it. From his own pocket.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: (not wanting to argue) Okay.

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: You mean ‘okay’ no. You’re wrong.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I’ve been wrong before. But not this time.

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: I can prove you’re wrong. Take me to Mu’‘tah.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I don’t think so. Mu’tah’s not a place for me.

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: Nonsense. It’s perfectly safe. It's a university town. It’s where he teaches. You’1ll meet him. You’ll see. Ferris keeps driving. Doesn’t answer. Senses this may be the end of things here, and he’s right.

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: Fine. Take me home.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I’1ll take you to Mu’tah.  162 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 105. EXT. MU’TAH - DAY 162 FERRIS scans every house as he drives into the town. All the women wear headscarves. There are no Jordanian special forces, only useless unshaven provincial police. Most of the people are Bedu, stone 7th Century. It is a town of professional malcontents. But there is a university in this town, and Ferris parks at the entrance to the alley that leads to it.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: (faux unconcerned) This is no place to be an outsider.

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: I’m not an outsider.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Even for you.

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: I’1l be right back. She gets out, walks briskly down the alley. Ferris bashes his head back against the headrest. Looks around. Sees a HALF A DOZEN MEN playing soccer behind him, a unit of idling jihadists, no doubt about it. Ferris sinks down in the car, every fucker looking at him, and the soccer ball is driven deliberately into a side panel of the car, giving him a jolt. FERRIS thinks, what to do. And then gets abruptly out of the car. You don't want to be sitting down. He confronts the guys.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: (in his perfect Arabic) You have made a mistake, brothers. FERRIS bluffs it out, and in parade ground manner heads towards a cafe where an old man smoking a nargilah stares at him. FERRIS sits down at a cheap, wobbly table.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: A coffee, please. Medium sweet. And I need the toilet. The WAITER points. FERRIS stands and enters the cafe, aware that the soccer players were merely disconcerted. They are not leaving him alone. They come towards the cafe, one carrying the ball.  163 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 106.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a smeared hole in the floor. FERRIS pisses, smelling waves of shit. He turns, zipped up, and sees:

dialogues.speaker: THREE OF THE JIHADISTS
dialogues.text: FERRIS pulls his knife but is clubbed on the head and goes down on the filthy floor. One of the Jihadists picks up the knife and holds it to Ferris’ throat. Another Jihadist is looking through his wallet and finds: A US EMBASSY ID CARD. Much talk over this one. They have a real prize. FERRIS is half dragged to his feet and crammed against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: JIHADIST
dialogues.text: Why you come to Mu’tah? To spy on Muslim people?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I am diplomat from Amman. Visiting the university. I ama friend of Hani Pasha, and if you don’t know who he is, you will. I’'1ll forget what you’ve done, if you let me go. He is spit on, full in the face.

dialogues.speaker: JIHADIST
dialogues.text: Take him out the back. They open a door to the storeroom as... FERRIS breaks the nearest man’s jaw with the heel of his hand. We hear the sloppy pop of the sidewards dislocation. He headbutts the next man, sending him down, and knees him in the face. The KNIFEMAN is disarmed in one move and FERRIS pins him against the wall with the stiletto at his throat, held straight on, ready to punch in, a straight puncture.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Maybe I cut off your head, motherfucker. Maybe we start doing that. We’1ll all be on the same fuckin’ page. I’11 cut off your fucking head and throw it down the toilet. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: He knees the KNIFEMAN in the balls and puts him down, slamming his forehead against the sink in the process and knocking the old sink off one of its brackets with the force of the blow. He turns to see: AISHA, staring at him from the doorway. With her is the money-donating scholar -- HIJAZI -- in a white robe.

dialogues.speaker: HIJAZI
dialogues.text: (in Arabic to jihadists) Brothers, you shame the town. This good visitor has come with Miss Aisha. Apologize to him and beg his forgiveness for your ignorant and uncivilized behavior.

dialogues.speaker: JIHADIST
dialogues.text: I have made a mistake. It is customary...

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Keep your money. I accept that you made a mistake. AISHA and FERRIS stare at each other. He closes the knife. EXT. THE KING’S HIGHWAY - TWILIGHT 164 FERRIS pulls the car to the shoulder of the road. He has gotten out of Mu’tah. Now he succumbs to the fear. AISHA stares straight ahead.

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: You were going to kill that boy.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: He was a kidnapper. Not a ‘boy.’

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: And you know how to kill, don’t you. He doesn’t answer; there’s no point.

dialogues.speaker: AISHA
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you are... and you’re not going to tell me. There’s nowhere to go from there.  165 166 167 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 108. INT. FERRIS’ APARTMENT - NIGHT 165 Ferris looks very much like he did in the first scene. Tired. Sweating. Drinking. He looks like a man about to give it up... but instead picks up one of his phones and dials. As it rings (normally) in the receiver --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Garland reaches for a cell phone playing a tinny version of Mozart’s Piano Concerto No. 24.

dialogues.speaker: GARLAND
dialogues.text: Ferris...

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Send out the message taking credit. But make the responses go back to Sadiki’s actual account. Fuse his real and shadow bank accounts.

dialogues.speaker: GARLAND
dialogues.text: I can’t say ‘It’s been real.’ But you know what I mean. FERRIS, uncomfortable, hangs up. Garland sits at his laptop. He pastes an Arabic message into an open “Sadiki” email file. Message reads (subtitle it): “In the name of God, the Merciful God, the compassionate, we tell you that the Brothers of Awareness have completed against the Crusaders an operation that has struck at the heart of their evil designs...” INT. SADIKI’S OFFICES (RIYADH) - NIGHT 167 Sadiki and a couple of assistant architects are working late on the “Hayes Andover Bank” revisions. At his computer, Sadiki is scrolling down a list of insulation manufacturers when a chime alerts him he has a new incoming e-mail message. Not a man who gets a lot of e- mail, Sadiki is intrigued to see that he has 1,298 messages downloading. “Omar, I don't understand. What is this?" Sadiki opens the first message, from JIHADBOY2, and reads (subtitle it): “Congratulations brother in your endeavors to destroy the great Satan.” (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Sadiki stares at “his” incoming messages. “God will reward you.” SADIKI SCROLLS DOWN and sees the copy of the message that Garland sent as “Omar Sadiki.” He glances up at the others in the room, all bent over drafting tables, then suddenly realizes that the wall of glass he so proudly designed in his office affords, from the buildings across, a fishbowl view of him. He quickly gathers his things to leave -- and passes a flat-panel TV in the waiting lounge...

dialogues.speaker: TV NEWSREADER, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Credit for the Incirlik bombing has been claimed by a mysterious group called the Ikhwan Ishfan... INT. SADIKI’S BUILDING - NIGHT 168 Coming down an elevator alone, he almost hyperventilates. The doors open and he ventures out warily into the underground garage. He sees no one, but fears for his life. He fumbles his car keys from his pocket as he crosses toward his reserved parking space which, until now, he never noticed was so goddamned far from the elevators. He presses what he thinks is the unlock button on the key ring, but mistakenly hits the panic button and the car’s alarm goes off and the headlights blink. Out of his wits he presses at all the other buttons until it silences. He pulls his car door open, slides in quickly, locks himself in. Trying to catch his breath, he stares out the windshield at the few other cars there, and the shadowy corners of the garage...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car pulls up. Al-Saleem’s lieutenant climbs out from the passenger seat, leaving the driver inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Al-Saleem regards printouts of the e-mails and a photo of Sadiki himself. Re: the photo (subtitles): (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: 170A
dialogues.text: 171 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 110.

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: This is the man who has been receiving our money? The Lieutenant nods.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: And it seems he blew up the US base, Sheikh.

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: He looks like an accountant.

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: He’s an architect in Amman. Successful.

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: That is an understatement. Al-Saleem reaches for a cell phone, holds it for a moment, looking at it, like he knows he shouldn’t do this, then flips it open and dials...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CELL TOWER in a European city. CACOPHONY of voices in different languages. These and MORE VOICES plucked by an ARRAY OF SAT-DISHES in an American desert -- The WORLD'S CHATTER as it’s sifted through by NSA word- flagging and voice-recognition computers -- Buried in it all at first, one voice begins to surface: Al-Saleem’s --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERRIS exits the terminal. Ferris’ phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You did it, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: WITH
dialogues.text: 172 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 111.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Sneaking a cigarette on the balcony of his townhouse glancing in from time to time to make sure his kids don’t catch him.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: NSA is picking up voices it hasn’t heard in years, including one on a World Phone from Vienna we think is Al-Saleem himself, saying something to the effect of, ‘Who the fuck is Omar Sadiki.’ HOFFMAN is interrupted by a small fist tapping on the glass door. He cups the cigarette and looks at his son who’s holding up a toy that needs new batteries.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: What the fuck’s Daddy supposed to do about that? Go ask Mommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERRIS climbs into a waiting SUV. TONY, in front, hands a gun and ammunition back to Ferris, and pulls the car away. SKIP is sitting nervously beside FERRIS.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I’m bringing him in.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Who.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Sadiki. He’s gonna get hurt.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Oh, please. Decide what side of the cross you’re on, Buddy. I need nailers, not hangers.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I’m bringing him in. He’s innocent, Ed.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Oh, please! Sadiki isn’t innocent -- the only difference between him and the other Salafi motherfuckers is he was the only one with a job. (Ferris has hung up) Ferris? (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: In the car, Ferris flips his phone closed. He looks over at SKIP, who looks deservedly anxious. FERRIS punches him in the head. As SKIP spits blood.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Ferris! Hello!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The SUV pulls to the curb. Tony indicates a particular house down the block. Ferris climbs out tucking his gun in the waistband behind his back. SKIP and Tony clip their own guns and stay in the car. As Ferris walks toward the house, he notices another parked car with a couple guys in it. Could be anyone, but he keeps an eye on them as he keeps going. The front door of the house opens and Sadiki steps out looking scared to death. He heads quickly for his car, parked the other way from where Ferris is coming...

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Omar... Sadiki looks back. Sees Ferris. Stares at him...

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: It’s okay...

dialogues.speaker: SADIKI
dialogues.text: What are you doing here?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Come with me.

dialogues.speaker: SADIKI
dialogues.text: What? Sadiki looks around. Sees the guys in the other car. Looks back to Ferris confused: What is Hayes Andover Bank’s Brad Scanlon doing here?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: (shouting in Arabic) You have to trust me, Omar! Sadiki doesn’t. Bolts. Ferris takes off after him. Tony shoves the SUV in gear -- (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: From the rooftops -- perhaps someone’s POV -- Sadiki can be seen sprinting across the street to his car -- Ferris reaches it just as Sadiki closes the door and locks it. Ferris smashes at the side window, tries to grab Sadiki, but he’s got the car started, kicks at the accelerator. Sadiki speeds down the street -- toward Tony speeding toward him. Both, to avoid colliding, have the presence of mind to pull at their steering wheels. Unfortunately, they both turn the same way, and do collide -- SKIP, without a steering wheel to hold onto, is thrown through the windshield of the SUV -- As Ferris sprints toward the crash, Sadiki hobbles out from his car. The guys from the other car grab and drag him back to theirs, covered by the gunmen on the roofs -- Ferris only gets one shot off before the gunfire from above strafes the parked cars he’s using for cover. He looks up, sees gunmen along the rooftops, returns their fire on the run as he tries to catch up to Sadiki -- Tony is trying to drag SKIP to cover when the shots from above drive him back. The kidnappers throw Sadiki in their car and pull away from the carnage --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sadiki sits alone in a room. He’s not tied up, but he’s scared. An Arab man we’ve never seen before comes in and sits down. Silence. Then -- all in Arabic -- subtitled:

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: God praises you for your work. Nothing from Sadiki.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: The Sheikh praises you for your work. Nothing from Sadiki. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: The House of Islam rejoices at the strike you have made against the House of War. SADIKI can’t take it.

dialogues.speaker: SADIKI
dialogues.text: I don’t know what you’re talking about. I’m an architect.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: You have nothing to be afraid of here. Do you think we are the moukhabarat? Do you think we are Americans trying to trick you?

dialogues.speaker: SADIKI
dialogues.text: I don’t want to know who you are!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where Al-Saleem and a few other men listen to the interview and watch a closed-circuit video of it live:

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Mr. Sadiki, we've read your statements taking credit for what you did at Incirlik. You don’t have to pretend. We are not angry that you took our money... Look what you have done with it! We congratulate you...

dialogues.speaker: SADIKI, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: Someone else is doing something to me I don’t understand. The American has done this.

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: studying the video image of Sadiki’s frightened pleading face.

dialogues.speaker: SADIKI, (V.0.)
dialogues.text: (losing it) The American did this to me! He pretended to want me to design a bank. I will tell you everything I know. The MAN reaches out and touches Omar’s prayer-callus. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: You are a pious man. We will believe you. The awful thing is that if Al-Saleem does believe him, he is dead.

dialogues.speaker: MAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Tell about this American.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Some kids with goats moving along an embankment stop and look down at dark water in a ditch below. There’s something half-submerged in it: Sadiki’s body.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris gets a snack from a vending machine, carries it down a corridor to a door guarded by TONY and Saudi security, goes inside and sits. SKIP, who has survived, sleeps, flanked by IVs. Ferris’ phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Sadiki’s dead. Nothing from Ferris.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Are you there?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I heard you.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: I didn’t kill him, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I know you didn’t. I did.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Here we go... (a beat) You know, buddy, this just isn’t constructive. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 181 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 116.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: How are you measuring that? By how much closer you got to Al- Saleem? You probably got a shitload of chatter and then it stopped.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: That's right. FERRIS leans against the wall.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Then where is Al-Saleem? HOFFMAN doesn’t know and neither does Ferris.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: There’s data to be analyzed...

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I’ve had it. I can’t do this anymore.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Don’t be a drama queen for Christ’s sake. Get some sleep for a couple hours and call me when you're thinking straight.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I am thinking straight. You're not and you can’t because you’re a million fuckin’ miles away. I’m here. I see every fucking day what you only look at pictures of. I am thinking straight. Nothing from Hoffman. Ferris absently touches the festering wound that Aisha pulled the last piece of Bassam from.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: It’s not working. Ferris hangs up. Hoffman hangs up and looks at the analysts in the room all looking at him. Eventually, more to himself --

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: I should pack.  182 183 184 185 186 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 117. INT. FERRIS’ APARTMENT (AMMAN) - DAY 182 Footsteps. Rattle of a key in the lock. The door opens and Ferris’ shoes step on a manila envelope just inside. He opens the envelope. Finds inside it: A SURVEILLANCE PHOTO of himself with Aisha walking toward his car after the debacle in Mu’tah. No note. Suddenly:

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ON SOUND -- A RINGING PHONE -- as FERRIS hurries across the road and into the building -- cell phone to his ear - INT. HALLWAY OF AISHA’S APARTMENT - MOMENTS LATER 184 THE RINGING PHONE goes to Aisha’s voice mail. Ferris disconnects it and hits “redial” as he hurries down the hallway. The ringing phone again as he knocks, gets no answer, tries the knob. It turns. He enters -- INT. AISHA'S APARTMENT —- CONTINUOUS ACTION 185 It's been rifled, nothing destroyed, but everything askew, nothing where it was. BOOKS have been pulled off the shelves. AISHA’S CELL PHONE vibrates on the desk... FERRIS pulls his pistol.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Aisha? No answer. In the KITCHEN, FERRIS sees the remains of breakfast: a bowl of cereal, open carton of milk. He smells the milk: not bad yet. It’s then he sees: A trail of drops of blood that leads to the back door. He follows it. Comes through the back door and looks at the flight of open stairs leading down into an alley. He hurries back in, hits a speed dial number on his phone, pockets Aisha’s now silent cell phone from the desk.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I need a team. Immediately.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An Amman Station FBI forensics team dusts for prints, takes blood samples, as Ferris sits with Aisha’s sister and kids. EMBASSY GUY comes in and gestures to Ferris they need to talk. Ferris joins him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: EMBASSY GUY
dialogues.text: Hoffman wants you to call him. Says yours is going straight to voice mail. He’s on his way here from Washington. The EMBASSY GUY offers his phone, but Ferris doesn’t take it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FERRIS knows where he is going. Comes past MARWAN, sitting at the bar and heads into the back of the place where Hani is entertaining a gorgeous Indian woman. FERRIS stands and stares at HANI. If Hani knows anything, he is an impeccable actor. The Indian woman realizes it is time to visit the ladies room. After she’s gone:

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I invented Omar Sadiki. He’s not a Jihadist... I moved him around... moved money. He was my operation. Then I lost him.

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: That is impossible...

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Why.

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: Because it would mean you sat in my office and lied to me to my face. Ferris doesn’t bother apologizing, and Hani doesn’t expect him to.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: They've kidnapped a friend of mine, Hani, to get to me. You know who I’m talking about. I need your help brokering a trade. Her for me. They'll kill her, Hani. Hani takes a sip of wine. Lets Ferris wait. Then --

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: You have lied to me. I will not help you. Goodbye.  188 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 119.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoffman comes down the steps of a private jet, cell phone to his ear. Ferris waits for him on the tarmac. Hoffman closes the phone and they cross the tarmac to a car --

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: You should have told me you were getting serious about the girl, buddy. We could have watched her.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: They left the phone. I know how this goes, Ed. They took Aisha. This means someone has to take her place.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: If she’s alive.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: She’s gotta be alive.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Probably she’s alive. At least they want you to think so. That’s the good part.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: What’s the bad part?

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Well, they know about you. That you work for the agency. That tells us two things. One, the people who have Aisha are running the show and are close to Al- Saleem. Two, they have learned enough from Miss Aisha to know that she’s your pal. Which is to say, she’s been interrogated.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: She’s alive. They'll call.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: You can’t tell Hani. Did you go see Hani?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: By ‘no’ you mean ‘yes?’ (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: +e

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Why did you do that?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Because I have to trust everyone right now.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: No, you only have to trust me. What did he say?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Ma’alesh. Because I lied to him. * Again. He’s not going to help. As they climb into one of the Embassy cars by the plane, Aisha’s cell phone vibrates once in Ferris’ pocket... a text message... Ferris and Hoffman both read:

dialogues.speaker: TEXT MESSAGE
dialogues.text: “Mr Ferris, please call Miss Aisha, 963.9325.8771”

dialogues.speaker: BACK TO SCENE
dialogues.text: FERRIS starts to make the call. HOFFMAN puts a hand on * the phone.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: No. We have to get it set up. We have to do it right. This ain’t just about you and your girlfriend. +e  189 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 120.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris, a phone to his ear, listens to ringing. WIDER REVEALS Hoffman and some NSA TECHS in a room full of tracing equipment. The call connects.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: This is Roger Ferris. I want to talk to Aisha.

dialogues.speaker: ARAB VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Okay, Mister, thanks God you are calling. I have a question, to make sure you are you, please.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Fine.

dialogues.speaker: ARAB VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Where do you meet Miss Aisha, first time?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: A medical clinic in Amman. She’s a nurse.

dialogues.speaker: ARAB VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Where do you take Miss Aisha for dinner, first time?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I didn’t. She invited me to her apartment for dinner.

dialogues.speaker: ARAB VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Did you bring anything?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I did. Dessert. Pastry. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: ARAB VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: If you want to see Miss Aisha you must go where I say. To trade you for her. No trick or Miss Aisha will die.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Tell me where I’m to go.

dialogues.speaker: ARAB VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: I tell you where to go. It is near the border... Highway 15... Dera... the street is... Everyone in the room is writing it down...

dialogues.speaker: ARAB VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: That’s where you go. Goodbye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris and Hoffman are alone in the audio room now. One of them is looking at a dead man. Eventually --

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Our body count of innocent people is pretty high and she had nothing to do with this. It’s my decision.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: I don’t agree with this Ferris. It’s a Goddamn waste.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: It's be nice if you could have a Predator up there -- in case I get lucky.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: I can’t risk having you taken.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: (cynically) But you get to catch the bad guys, Ed. Can’t pass that one up, can you?

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: I can’t risk having you taken. HOFFMAN pushes a box across the table containing -- FERRIS opens it -- a GEL BRIDGE. Silence. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: This is a gel bridge. You put it in your mouth, bite down hard on it. It releases a poison, very quick, very easy and tastes good, or so I’m told. I haven’t had pleasure.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Would you take one of these?

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: I take one of these every time I fly...Do we agree on this ? I won’t think you’re a pussy if you say no. But I will end the conversation and the operation right now. FERRIS puts the box in his coat.  191 192 193 194 195 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 122.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BMW roars along the road. We see a sign ahead in Arabic and English for Dera (which incidentally is where Lawrence copped one from the Bey).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE BMW turns into a courtyard where a MERCEDES TAXI waits, the TAXI DRIVER calmly smoking a cigarette. FERRIS gets out, takes a deep breath, listens to the neighborhood sounds: children, mothers, radios, birds. He glances back at the rear-side window of the BMW, but all he sees in the black tint is his own reflection. He crosses to the Mercedes. The taxi driver, who looks like a gangster, lifts the back seat revealing a space between it and the trunk. FERRIS gets in it and is handed a bottle of water. FERRIS’ POV The compartment is closed. BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: THE TAXI DRIVER has the fix in: the car is waved through into Syria.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Mercedes, having crossed a hundred miles of empty plain, stops at an outcropping of rubble walls that was once a small town. THE DRIVER helps FERRIS out of the compartment and leads him away from the car, telling him --

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Okay, stand here. Ferris can’t imagine why, but does as he’s told. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: The DRIVER walks across the “street” of the “town,” eyes darting to the few places someone could be hiding. He reaches a particular rubble wall. Looks behind it. Kneels down. As Ferris watches, the Driver stands back up with a Nike sports bag -- of all things -- in his hand.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) What’s that? The Driver crosses back to his cab without answering, throws the bag onto the front seat, and points off.

dialogues.speaker: DRIVER
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) You go there. She’s there. Ferris looks to where he’s pointing, but there’s nothing to see there -- or anywhere -- but endless desert.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Where. But the Driver has given enough instructions. Climbs into his car. Drives away. Ferris watches the car drive off, looks back to where the Driver pointed... and begins to walk “there”...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris sits alone in the middle of an absolutely flat plain. Nothing in sight in any direction. He glances off in the general direction of a faint sound and sees in the far distance through heat waves: A small cloud of roiling dust with a black center that could be a rider on a black horse. Gradually, as it comes closer, he can discern it’s actually a car leading three other cars, speeding toward him across the hardpan. He pulls a rock closer to him and smashes his phone against it. Takes out the SIM card with its store of numbers, covers it with sand, tosses the phone away. He looks up into the sky shielding his eyes to the bright sun, hoping to see a metallic glint -- a Predator -- but sees nothing there. He stands. And like a condemned man, lights a last cigarette as he waits for the arrival of his kidnappers.  197 198 199 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 124.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A SCREEN: From 20,000 feet: A graphic live image from miles above the desert, of the dust cloud -- like the contrail of a jet -- moving toward the dot that is Ferris. Hoffman, Holiday, and several others watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four cars stop thirty yards away from Ferris, dust engulfing them. Ferris raises his hands, so there’s no mistake, but nothing happens. No one appears from the dust. In Arabic:

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Where is she? Where is she? Several armed men suddenly break through the wall of dust and throw Ferris to the ground. They quickly search him for weapons and GPS devices, duct-tape his hands behind his back, and drag him into the dust cloud to one of the idling cars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone stares at the Predator image, which is the cloud of dust, and nothing else. Then the four cars emerge from it, drive straight for a bit, then split apart in four different directions...

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: (to himself) Fuck me... Everyone looks at Hoffman who for once in his life looks unsure of himself.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: (somewhere ) What do we do? Which one do we follow? It's the Lady or the Tiger, only the odds are worse. No answer is the right one...

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: That one. To the north. He points to one of the cars only because he has to point to one of them. And, to himself:

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Sorry, buddy.  200 201 202 203 204 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 125.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wherever we are, it’s very close to the blown speakers of a mosque. Bugs crawl on shattered walls. FERRIS’ belongings and wallet are sorted through. His watch is put on a skinny wrist. His MATCHBOX is shaken. The tablet is turned over in fingers. Ferris -- we assume it’s Ferris -- there’s a black cloth sack over his head -- sits on a cot -- the only “furniture” in the room -- hands still duct-taped behind him. His head turns to the sound of a door opening, and someone -- more than one -- lift him from the cot and lead him out.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 201
dialogues.text: Ferris can only listen to where he’s headed now -- which could be anywhere, he figures, within a 500-mile radius of where he was picked up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He’s asleep -- or at least lying down -- in another anonymous room.

dialogues.speaker: NIGHT 203
dialogues.text: Another drive. The same nothing-but-car-engine clue to where he is, which is no clue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris now sitting on a wooden chair, without which the room would be bare. He hears the door open, someone walk in, set something down. He feels a hand near his neck and flinches slightly, but it’s only taking the sack from his head from behind. As the cloth comes off, Ferris sees this tableaux in front of him: A small wooden table. Wash basin, hand-towel, soap, plastic Bic razor. Standing next to the table, looking rather more wary of Ferris than Ferris is of him, an Arab man wearing a little white cap and traditional dress, like an ATTENDANT at a bathhouse.

dialogues.speaker: ATTENDANT
dialogues.text: (in Arabic) Make yourself clean.  205 206 207 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 126.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The chair has been moved against the wall. Ferris is sitting on it, bright light shining on his clean-shaven face. Fifteen feet away, just beyond lights on stands, is a video camera on a tripod, its red record light blinking. Behind that, in the shadows, stand several men. One of the men comes forward with another chair. Positions it and sits. One of the other men looks in the camera eyepiece, and, like every cameraman in the world, has to fool with the set dressing, gesturing to the man in the chair to move it one inch to the right.

dialogues.speaker: MAN
dialogues.text: (holding out paper) Say what is on this paper. Say you are sorry to the Muslim peoples. FERRIS reads the paper, then hands it back.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Fuck you. MEN start to move at him, but a signal is given and they relax.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris against the wall, and the back of the man in the chair, like the moderator of an interview program, still slightly in frame. The camera zooms just enough to put him O.S. Ferris doesn’t see him, but MUSTAFA KARAMI is among the dark figures behind the camera. (Make sure there’s enough without Karami visible, for later reveal.) Someone else goes out a door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A car pulls up. A figure climbs from the passenger seat. As he enters a building, the car continues down the street, perhaps to go around back...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crew waits for the talent. The door behind them opens and he comes in. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Stands completely backlit -- to Ferris -- looking at him. Then -- having done this before -- he goes around the light stands and cords and hits his mark without having entered the video’s frame. Ferris -- in full light -- is now looking at Al-Saleem backlit in the chair. Long silence. The blinking light on the camera. Finally --

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: Salaam, C.I.A. He says each letter as if it is a word.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Salaam, Sheikh.

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: I am not the Sheikh. The Sheikh who is, God praise him, is the Sheikh who always was. I am his servant. FERRIS waits. No one says anything.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Where is the girl? AL-SALEEM cocks his head, puzzled.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: (angry) Where is she? AL-SALEEM is genuinely puzzled for a moment. Then after a long beat.

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: I think the trickster has been tricked. You were bought, my friend. FERRIS has the dawn of a smile. He’s figuring it out.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN 207A
dialogues.text: Sitting in a chair at the embassy, looking morally ambiguous.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Who sold me? (off no answer) (MORE) (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS, (CONT'D)
dialogues.text: We don’t negotiate. You think you'll trade me for your brothers.

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: Why would I want them, Mister Ferris? I don’t need them, there’s more where they came from. This is a world of poverty and frustration and filth and humiliation. There’s no shortage of recruits in this world. The BROTHERS look at each other. Ferris is fucked and he knows it but he sees a way to play the situation:

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I forgot I was talking to a man who murders his own men but never risks himself. Who feels his ‘brothers’ are dispensable. Glances past Al-Saleem to the executioners in the shadows behind the camera. There is a stir among the brothers. Al-Saleem, pissed off that he had an unusual slip of ego, studies him...

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: Are you a Jew?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: For you? Why not? He moves like lightning to drive his thumb into Al- Saleem’s eye. AL-SALEEM falls backwards, his eye socket merely grazed. FERRIS, still not recovered from his lunge, is shot in the thigh. He falls to the PLASTIC- COVERED FLOOR. AL-SALEEM, a bit of blood at the corner of his eye socket, grabs the agonized FERRIS by the shirt.

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: I could bind you. You want to be bound? FERRIS’ hands are lashed behind his back.

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: (punching FERRIS) How do you like it? Do you like it? Pay attention. He spits on FERRIS. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: You have more of our attention than you want.

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: I do? Please tell me. FERRIS is grabbed and sat in his chair. He almost screams when his leg is flexed. Recovers...

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: Tell me about this ‘attention.’

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I'd rather it be a surprise.

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: There are no surprises.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: How long did it take you to use your phone after the ‘Fig Orchard,’ Sheikh? AL-SALEEM stares at him.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: How long did it take? AL-SALEEM backhands him.

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: You know nothing. What country are you in?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Do you think the people who ‘sold’ me were what they seemed to be, Sheikh?

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: There are always precautions. No one knows where you are. And because Hoffman lost Ferris on predator cam, we think so, too.

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: Do you think you will be rescued? Do you think the cavalry is coming for you? Let’s wait. Let’s listen for your friends. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: Al-Saleem lets silence settle in the room. A long pause. The Brothers are grinning. AL-SALEEM picks up Ferris’ Embassy ID. Looks at it.

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: I am not going to torture you, Mister Ferris. I know you will not read what is prepared for you on the paper. (crumples it) You know what that camera is for. It’s not for this. This is Intermission. It’s for what comes after this. Ferris does know. And when Al-Saleem gets up, he knows the time for it has come. Al-Saleem calmly walks away, back the way he came, around the light stands and cords, and out the door. Ferris’ eyes shift to the blinking red light on the camera. Then behind it to the men getting ready in the shadows -- gathering up their beheading knives, putting on their black knit masks. And then they come... Ferris, who isn’t cuffed, goes for the closest one, digging his thumbs into the man’s eyes, but is quickly set upon by the others who knock him to the floor, and in a violent blur, punch and kick him to within an inch of unconsciousness, a horrific beating... Now they cinch his hands behind his back with nylon cuffs. Lift him up and sit him on the chair. Line up behind him, posed with their knives for the camera. One of them, who we might recognize from his eyes as Al- Saleem’s lieutenant, speaks to it, in Arabic (subtitles):

dialogues.speaker: LIEUTENANT
dialogues.text: When the Believers saw the Allies, they said: This is what Allah and his Apostle promised us, and Allah and his Apostle spoke the truth, increasing them in their faith. He’s done. Grabs Ferris’ hair to pull his head back for the knives that will cut it off -- Ferris’ eyes shift as if to see the KNIFE but as he does he sees a man standing to the side who he has not seen before in the room: MUSTAFA KARAMI. Ferris has an instant to recognize that Hani’s guy is staring at him. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: 208 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 131.

dialogues.speaker: CONTINUED
dialogues.text: A FLASHBANG clatters across the dusty wooden floor. Everyone looks to it as it explodes, concussing them. Ferris’ hair blasts back as he topples from the chair. Doors and shutters are torn away and brilliant light bursts in on the already blinded men -- MEN IN BLACK TACTICALS advance into the room, shooting some of the jihadists, slamming others to the floor. Ferris, lying with blood trickling from an ear, watches boots go past his face... sees jihadists dragged away from him across the floor toward the open door... sees exquisite loafers step into the room and approach his face...

dialogues.speaker: HANI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: Help him. Ferris feels someone cutting the nylon ties behind his back, but not much else, not even the deep rough jab of the morphine syringe into his neck... INT. A HOSPITAL ROOM — DAY 208 FERRIS is sitting up on crisp hospital bed sheets, ina private room, face battered, but cleaned and stitched. A NURSE enters, and Ferris glimpses a SOLDIER in the hallway before the door closes again.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Where am I?

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: Amman. The Nurse checks Ferris’ dressing, without much TLC. Like millions of others, she probably hates him. HANI appears in the doorway, wearing the same loafers, biting the end off a cigar. As he comes in, (in Arabic) --

dialogues.speaker: NURSE
dialogues.text: You can’t smoke in here, sir.

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: I am Hani Salaam. I can smoke anywhere I like, my dear. He sits with his unlit cigar. Waits for her to leave. Lights it up with his gold lighter and looks at Ferris. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: You can always tell who cares about you most by who comes first to visit you in a hospital. I think I’m first. Which, however, would not be difficult because no one else knows where you are. Ferris nods; Hani bats at cigar smoke with his hand. Hani looks around for something to use as an ashtray, draws a small plastic wastebasket closer with his shoe.

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: Edward couldn’t find you. With all his aircraft. All his people. All his money... How did I do it?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: With Karami, who you left in place.

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: My compliments. (a beat) It is clear why Edward finds you so valuable. (blows smoke) I’m sorry I was late. A few minutes later? I shudder to think. FERRIS’ hand grabs Hani by the collar of his nice shirt. Hani doesn’t resist. Thinking Hani might have been deliberately a little too late.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I shudder too, Hani. And how frightened was Aisha when you took her?

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: Not at all. I explained that it was for reasons of state security. I was very polite.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: There was blood.

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: She gives blood every month. She is a thoughtful woman. FERRIS loosens his grip on him. Hani shrugs like, no mystery there. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: I have explained to her that you tried to give your life for hers. That goes very far with women. Indeed with people in general. I think she will talk to you again. FERRIS smiles.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: She doesn’t want a man in the CIA, Hani. Hani looks appraisingly at Ferris through cigar smoke.

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: Perhaps... you can give her that. Is it a job offer?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Perhaps.

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: You are a hero, my dear. Perhaps not so much as me. But we shall not be overwhelmed by vanity. Ed shall find a way to have all the credit. We shall let him have it. Hani stands.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: What did you get out of Al-Saleem? HANI smiles.

dialogues.speaker: A VIDEO 208A
dialogues.text: A bedraggled looking Al-Saleem is reading a statement in Arabic off a shaking paper. It looks like the first video we saw him in. Subtitled:

dialogues.speaker: AL-SALEEM
dialogues.text: Because to my shame I have been an agent of the Jews and Crusaders, no operation is safe. The man beside you is not your friend. Do not trust him. Do not trust the brothers. We are penetrated.  209 210 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 134.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ARMORED SUVS and ear-pieced SECURITY outside an unfrequented trattoria strangely like the one across from the Berber Palace. INT. THE RESTAURANT —- CONTINUOUS ACTION 210 HOFFMAN sits looking at Ferris, waiting for the answer to the same question Hani asked ...

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: You're blown here. You're coming back with me where there's an office down the hall from mine, and as soon as I throw the guy in it out of it, it's yours. More money. Less sunscreen and couscous.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Down the hall from you.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Don't think about it too long, I'll take it as a slight. Besides what else are you going to do, stay here?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Why wouldn't I.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Why would you?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: I like the Middle East.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: No one likes the Middle East. There's nothing to like here. Ferris regards Hoffman for a long moment ...

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: That's the problem right there. Ferris gets up to leave. Hoffman casts around in his chair. Finally manages to admit:

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: You're the best I got. You know it kills me to say that. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Good luck with the war, Ed.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: You're not safe here.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Or anywhere else, come to think of it. (beat)

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Safe trip home. Say hi to the wife and kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ferris stands some distance away from the camp clinic. Watches Aisha attending to patients. Helping people who need help. Something he’s never really done. He thinks about going over there to talk to her. Then doesn’t. Walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A vendor puts some konafa pastry, the same kind Ferris brought to Aisha’s apartment when he had dinner there, in the same kind of box.

dialogues.speaker: HANI, (0.S.)
dialogues.text: For you, or for a friend? Ferris sees Hani picking through fruit at another stall, not looking at him, like he’s talking to himself --

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: Because if they’re for someone important -- and I have a feeling they are -- I should show you where you can get better ones.

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: These will do. Ferris pays for the pastry, walks over to Hani and watches him carefully select fruit. (CONTINUED)

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: Al-Saleem didn’t get away, did he? You let him escape.

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: You’re thinking like me now. That could be dangerous. Are you sure you do not have Arab blood?

dialogues.speaker: FERRIS
dialogues.text: We think like that too, Hani, not just you.

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: The war will go on with or without you -- which is it going to be, do you think? With or without you? If there’s one thing Ferris isn’t certain of, it’s that.

dialogues.speaker: HANI
dialogues.text: You're right. Don’t answer that yet. Live life. Enjoy the pastry and the company of your friend. We can talk later. You know where to find me. Here, take these strawberries. They will make up for your inferior konafa. Hani gives him a bag of strawberries and disappears into the marketplace. Ferris wanders off the other way, comes around a stall and notices a guy he immediately pegs as an agent. The guy turns away; Ferris browses at produce.

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What’s he doing?

dialogues.speaker: AGENT, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: Nothing. Buying vegetables.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoffman, in an executive terminal, helps himself to a croissant and coffee, phone mic dangling from his ear --

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: Watch him. If nothing else, maybe someone will try to take him and we can see who it is.  214 215 216 217 218 219 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 137.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The agent hangs up his cell phone. Keeps an eye on Ferris. Watches as he walks away, into the dangers all around him --

dialogues.speaker: A PREDATOR VIEW 215
dialogues.text: of Ferris walking away.

dialogues.speaker: VOICE, (V.O.)
dialogues.text: What about us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The same live overhead image of Ferris walking away.

dialogues.speaker: PREDATOR OPERATOR
dialogues.text: Are we following him, too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hoffman is faced with a momentous decision... Nonfat, 2% skim, or pure cream in three silver milk boats, each with its own little identifying paper tag. He chooses the thick cream, stirs it slowly in his coffee in the executive lounge, and --

dialogues.speaker: HOFFMAN
dialogues.text: No. Too expensive. He’s not worth that much. Buddy’s done.

dialogues.speaker: THE PREDATOR VIEW 218
dialogues.text: of Ferris WIDENS until he is just a speck among many in the crowded Arab street, and keeps WIDENING until we see the whole city, the Dead Sea, Israel, Syria, Iraq, Saudi Arabia, the Mediterranean Sea...

dialogues.speaker: ON SOUND
dialogues.text: An AURAL COLLAGE: Intelligence CHATTER. And:

dialogues.speaker: IN LONDON 219
dialogues.text: The MILK VAN tools through Soho Square, parks. A man gets out, disappears around the corner...  220 221 CHATTER 9/21/07 -- PINK 138.

dialogues.speaker: IN PARIS 220
dialogues.text: A NEWSPAPER VAN parks near The Tuileries...

dialogues.speaker: AND ON CCTV CAMERAS AROUND THE WORLD 221
dialogues.text: one van, then another, then another, then another, the aural collage increasing in volume and intensity, until we GO TO: BLACK.
